clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Risk Factors Likely to Influence Immuno of Combined Hepatitis A & B Vacc vs Monovalent Hepatitis A & B Vacc
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluate the Effect of Several Risk Factors That Are Likely to Influence the Immunogenicity of GSK Biologicals' Combined Hepatitis A & B Vaccine, vs Separately Administered Monovalent Hepatitis A and Hepatitis B Vaccines

brief_summary.textblock: The focus of this study is to evaluate how risk factors like age, gender, body mass index, smoking, alcohol consumption, etc. can influence immune response when subjects are vaccinated with GSK Biologicals' combined hepatitis A/hepatitis B vaccine or monovalent hepatitis A and B vaccines (from GSK Biologicals' or different manufacturers). The Protocol Posting has been updated in order to comply with the FDA Amendment Act, Sep 2007.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will also evaluate the persistence of hepatitis A and hepatitis B antibodies at months 12, 24 and 36 after the first dose of primary vaccination course.

primary_outcome.measure: Antibody Concentrations for Anti-hepatitis A Virus (Anti-HAV) and Anti-hepatitis B Surface (Anti-HBs) Antigens
primary_outcome.description: Anti-HAV and anti-HBs antibody concentrations are presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in milli International Units per milliliter (mIU/mL). The reference seropositivity cut-off values for anti-HAV and anti-HBs antibodies were equal to or above (≥) 15 mIU/mL and ≥ 3.3 mIU/mL, respectively.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-HAV and Anti-HBs Antibody Concentrations Above the Cut-off Value
primary_outcome.description: Seropositivity for anti-HAV antibodies was defined as anti-HAV antibody concentration ≥ 15mIU/mL; seropositivity for anti-HBs antibodies was defined as anti-HBs antibody concentration ≥ 3.3 mIU/mL.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects Against Hepatitis B Surface (HBs) Antigen
primary_outcome.description: A seroprotected subject was defined as a vaccinated subject with a serum anti-HBs antibody concentration equal to or above (≥) 10 mIU/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-HAV and Anti-HBs Antibody Concentrations
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-HAV and anti-HBs antibody concentrations are presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in milli International Units per milliliter (mIU/mL). The reference seropositivity cut-off values for anti-HAV and anti-HBs antibodies were equal to or above (≥) 15 mIU/mL and ≥ 3.3 mIU/mL, respectively.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-HAV and Anti-HBs Antibody Concentrations Above the Cut-off Value, by Gender
secondary_outcome.description: Seropositivity for anti-HAV antibodies was defined as anti-HAV antibody concentration equal to or above (≥) 15 mIU/mL and anti-HBs seropositivity was defined as anti-HBs antibody concentrations ≥ 3.3 mIU/mL. The seropositivity rates were stratified by gender (females and males).

The seropositivity rates were stratified by age as follows: ≤ 50 years of age (YOA), 51-60 YOA and ≥ 61 YOA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-HAV and Anti-HBs Antibody Concentrations Above the Cut-off Value, by Body Mass Index (BMI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.description: SAEs assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life-threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity. Note: 3 subjects reported SAEs prior to administration of the first dose of vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With SAEs
secondary_outcome.description: SAEs assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life-threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity. arm_group.description: Healthy and non-healthy male or female subjects, aged 41 years or older, who received combined Twinrix™ (720/20) vaccine, administered intramuscularly in the left deltoid region, according to a 0, 1 and 6 month schedule.

Healthy and non-healthy male or female subjects, aged 41 years or older, who received separate administrations of Engerix™-B (20 μg) vaccine, administered intramuscularly in the left deltoid region, according to a 0, 1 and 6 month schedule and Havrix™ (1440 EL.U) vaccine, administered intramuscularly in the right deltoid region, according to a 0 and 6 month schedule.

Healthy and non-healthy male or female subjects, aged 41 years or older, who received separate administrations of HB VAX PRO™ (10 μg) vaccine, administered intramuscularly in the left deltoid region, according to a 0, 1 and 6 month schedule and Vaqta™ (50 IU) vaccine, administered intramuscularly in the right deltoid region, according to a 0 and 6 month schedule.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Subjects who the investigator believes that they can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol should be enrolled in the study.
- Healthy and non-healthy male or female aged 41 years or older at the time of the first vaccination.
- Written informed consent obtained from the subject.
- No serological signs of hepatitis A or B infection at screening.
- If the subject is female, she must be of non-childbearing potential or, if of childbearing potential, she must be abstinent or have used adequate contraceptive precautions for 30 days prior to vaccination, have a negative pregnancy test and must agree to continue such precautions for two months after completion of the vaccination series.
Exclusion criteria:
- Use of any investigational or non-registered product (drug or vaccine) other than the study vaccines within 30 days preceding the first dose of study vaccine, or planned use during the study period.
- History of any hepatitis A or hepatitis B vaccination or infection, since the primary vaccination study 100382.
- History of allergic disease or reactions likely to be exacerbated by any component of the vaccine.
- Acute disease at the time of enrolment. .
- Pregnant or lactating female.
- Female planning to become pregnant or planning to discontinue contraceptive precautions during the primary vaccination period.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 596 subjects (199 in Twinrix Group, 200 in Engerix-B+Havrix Group and 197 in HB VAX PRO+Vaqta Group) were enrolled and vaccinated in the study.

group.description: Healthy and non-healthy male or female subjects, aged 41 years or older, who received combined Twinrix (720/20) vaccine, administered intramuscularly in the left deltoid region, according to a 0, 1 and 6 month schedule.

group.title: Engerix-B+Havrix Group
group.description: Healthy and non-healthy male or female subjects, aged 41 years or older, who received separate administrations of Engerix-B (20 μg) vaccine, administered intramuscularly in the left deltoid region, according to a 0, 1 and 6 month schedule and Havrix (1440 EL.U) vaccine, administered intramuscularly in the right deltoid region, according to a 0 and 6 month schedule.

measure.description: Seropositivity for anti-HAV antibodies was defined as anti-HAV antibody concentration ≥ 15mIU/mL; seropositivity for anti-HBs antibodies was defined as anti-HBs antibody concentration ≥ 3.3 mIU/mL.

analysis.groups_desc: Difference in seropositivity rates against hepatitis A virus (HAV) antigen: To demonstrate that the immunogenicity of Twinrix vaccine (Twinrix Group) administered at Months 0, 1 and 6 was non-inferior to that of separately administered monovalent vaccines Engerix-B at Months 0, 1 and 6 and Havrix at Months 0 and 6 (Engerix-B+Havrix Group), in terms of anti-HAV seropositivity rates, at Month 7.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was defined as the lower limit of the 95% CI for the difference between the two treatment groups (Twinrix Group minus Engerix-B+Havrix Group), in terms of seropositivity rates for anti-HAV antibody, being - 10%.

analysis.groups_desc: Difference in seropositivity rates against hepatitis A virus (HAV) antigen: To demonstrate that the immunogenicity of Twinrix vaccine (Twinrix Group) administered at Months 0, 1 and 6 was non-inferior to that of separately administered monovalent vaccines HB VAX PRO at Months 0, 1 and 6 and Vaqta at Months 0 and 6 (HB VAX PRO+Vaqta Group), in terms of anti-HAV seropositivity rates, at Month 7.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was defined as the lower limit of the 95% CI for the difference between the two treatment groups (Twinrix Group minus HB VAX PRO+Vaqta Group), in terms of seropositivity rates for anti-HAV antibody, being - 10%.

measure.title: Anti-HAV and Anti-HBs Antibody Concentrations, by Gender
measure.description: Anti-HAV and anti-HBs antibody concentrations are presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in milli International Units per milliliter (mIU/mL). The reference seropositivity cut-off values for anti-HAV and anti-HBs antibodies were equal to or above (≥) 15 mIU/mL and ≥ 3.3 mIU/mL, respectively. The antibody concentrations were stratified by gender (females and males).
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all subjects who met all eligibility criteria and for whom data concerning immunogenicity endpoint measures were available.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Anti-HAV and Anti-HBs Antibody Concentrations Above the Cut-off Value
outcome.description: Seropositivity for anti-HAV antibodies was defined as anti-HAV antibody concentration equal to or above (≥) 15 mIU/mL and anti-HBs seropositivity was defined as anti-HBs antibody concentrations ≥ 3.3 mIU/mL. Anti-HBs AUSAB = anti-HBs antibody concentrations were tested with AUSAB EIA /Abbott assay; Anti-HBs in-house = anti-HBs antibody concentrations were tested with in-house assay (bridging).
outcome.population: The analysis was performed Long Term According-To-Protocol (LT ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, which included all subjects who were included in the ATP cohort for immunogenicity in the primary study and who came within the blood sampling time interval at Months 12, 24 and 36.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: SAEs assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life-threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity. Note: 3 subjects reported SAEs prior to administration of the first dose of vaccination.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects for whom data were available.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
